scene_end_anchor: Artie reached the Oakhaven Safe Zone after fleeing the tutorial wilderness. The gate scanner malfunctioned while processing his stats, resulting in him being assigned the 'Statistical Anomaly' title. He was granted entry to the city under protest by the gate guards.
constraints: Artie has 1 HP and 1 MP; any damage taken is lethal due to rounding rules.
Artie is carrying the Participation Trophy in his left hand; it cannot be unequipped or stowed.
Artie is carrying the Broken Tutorial Sword in his right hand.
next_action: Artie negotiates with the Mayor of Oakhaven regarding his economic value as a Statistical Anomaly.

last_scene: Artie fled the Whispering Woods while pursued by a Level 4 Tutorial Wolf and a swarm of aggroed mobs.
He reached the Oakhaven Safe Zone, where the gate scanner malfunctioned while processing his impossible stats.
The System assigned him the 'Statistical Anomaly' title and allowed him entry into the city under protest.
chapter_so_far: Artie has died on Earth and entered the System's character creation void after a vending machine accident.
Artie met his guide, Fizz, and reviewed the details of his death.
Artie exploited the character creation system to create a high-variance 'Crit-Only' build.
Artie entered the Whispering Woods and engaged in his first combat encounter.
Artie discovered that the System's rounding mechanics make his 1 HP build extremely fragile.
Artie survived his first combat encounter by accidentally nuking the tutorial zone.
Artie discovered that his crits can overwrite System rules and destroy world objects.
Artie received a cursed Participation Trophy that makes him a magnet for all monsters and projectiles in the area.
Artie reached Oakhaven and was flagged as a Statistical Anomaly by the gate scanners.
key_facts_ring: Artie received the 'Participation Trophy' (Cursed/Soul-bound) as an achievement for causing a Tier 3 System Error.
Fizz identified the trophy's hidden stats: Aura of the Beacon (+500% aggro) and Magnetic Failure (projectile attraction).
A Level 4 Tutorial Wolf and a swarm of other mobs aggroed on Artie due to the trophy's effects.
Artie fled North toward a ravine as the tutorial zone's stability dropped to 84%.
Artie narrowly dodged a slime projectile that curved toward him due to the trophy's Magnetic Failure.
Artie's stamina dropped to 42/100 during the frantic retreat.

Artie has 1 HP and 1 MP; any damage taken is lethal.
Artie is carrying the Participation Trophy in his left hand; it cannot be unequipped or stowed.
The Participation Trophy increases aggro by 500% and attracts projectiles.
Artie's Super-Mega-Ultra-Crit is on a 24-hour cooldown.
Artie reached the Oakhaven Safe Zone, causing the monster aggro from the Participation Trophy to leash.
The Oakhaven gate scanner triggered a Fatal Error when analyzing Artie's 100% Crit Rate and 1 HP.
The System applied an emergency classification to Artie to resolve the data overflow.
Artie was assigned the title 'Statistical Anomaly'.
Artie entered Oakhaven officially, ending his time in the tutorial wilderness.
Artie's stamina dropped to 9/100 during the final sprint.
